text:
Paul and Timothy, bond-servants of Christ Jesus,
To all the saints in Christ Jesus who are in Philippi, including the overseers and deacons:
speaker: Narrator

text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank my God in all my remembrance of you,
speaker: Narrator

text: always offering prayer with joy in my every prayer for you all,
speaker: Narrator

text: in view of your participation in the gospel from the first day until now.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am confident of this very thing, that He who began a good work among you will complete it by the day of Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is only right for me to feel this way about you all, because I have you in my heart, since both in my imprisonment and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel, you all are partakers of grace with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God is my witness, how I long for you all with the affection of Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this I pray, that your love may overflow still more and more in real knowledge and all discernment,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you may discover the things that are excellent, that you may be sincere and blameless for the day of Christ;
speaker: Narrator

text: having been filled with the fruit of righteousness which comes through Jesus Christ, for the glory and praise of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I want you to know, brothers and sisters, that my circumstances have turned out for the greater progress of the gospel,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that my imprisonment in the cause of Christ has become well known throughout the praetorian guard and to everyone else,
speaker: Narrator

text: and that most of the brothers and sisters, trusting in the Lord because of my imprisonment, have far more courage to speak the word of God without fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some, to be sure, are preaching Christ even from envy and strife, but some also from goodwill;
speaker: Narrator

text: the latter do it out of love, knowing that I am appointed for the defense of the gospel;
speaker: Narrator

text: the former proclaim Christ out of selfish ambition rather than from pure motives, thinking that they are causing me distress in my imprisonment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What then? Only that in every way, whether in pretense or in truth, Christ is proclaimed, and in this I rejoice.
But not only that, I also will rejoice,
speaker: Narrator

text: for I know that this will turn out for my deliverance through your prayers and the provision of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: according to my eager expectation and hope, that I will not be put to shame in anything, but that with all boldness, Christ will even now, as always, be exalted in my body, whether by life or by death.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to me, to live is Christ, and to die is gain.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I am to live on in the flesh, this will mean fruitful labor for me; and I do not know which to choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I am hard-pressed from both directions, having the desire to depart and be with Christ, for that is very much better;
speaker: Narrator

text: yet to remain on in the flesh is more necessary for your sakes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Convinced of this, I know that I will remain and continue with you all for your progress and joy in the faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that your pride in Christ Jesus may be abundant because of me by my coming to you again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only conduct yourselves in a manner worthy of the gospel of Christ, so that whether I come and see you or remain absent, I will hear about you that you are standing firm in one spirit, with one mind striving together for the faith of the gospel;
speaker: Narrator

text: and in no way alarmed by your opponents—which is a sign of destruction for them, but of salvation for you, and this too, from God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to you it has been granted for Christ’s sake, not only to believe in Him, but also to suffer on His behalf,
speaker: Narrator

text: experiencing the same conflict which you saw in me, and now hear to be in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore if there is any encouragement in Christ, if any consolation of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any affection and compassion,
speaker: Narrator

text: make my joy complete by being of the same mind, maintaining the same love, united in spirit, intent on one purpose.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do nothing from selfishness or empty conceit, but with humility consider one another as more important than yourselves;
speaker: Narrator

text: do not merely look out for your own personal interests, but also for the interests of others.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have this attitude in yourselves which was also in Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: who, as He already existed in the form of God, did not consider equality with God something to be grasped,
speaker: Narrator

text: but emptied Himself by taking the form of a bond-servant and being born in the likeness of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And being found in appearance as a man, He humbled Himself by becoming obedient to the point of death: death on a cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason also God highly exalted Him, and bestowed on Him the name which is above every name,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that at the name of Jesus every knee will bow, of those who are in heaven and on earth and under the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and that every tongue will confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, my beloved, just as you have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling;
speaker: Narrator

text: for it is God who is at work in you, both to desire and to work for His good pleasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do all things without complaining or arguments;
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you will prove yourselves to be blameless and innocent, children of God above reproach in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation, among whom you appear as lights in the world,
speaker: Narrator

text: holding firmly the word of life, so that on the day of Christ I can take pride because I did not run in vain nor labor in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: But even if I am being poured out as a drink offering upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I rejoice and share my joy with you all.
speaker: Narrator

text: You too, I urge you, rejoice in the same way and share your joy with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I hope, in the Lord Jesus, to send Timothy to you shortly, so that I also may be encouraged when I learn of your condition.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have no one else of kindred spirit who will genuinely be concerned for your welfare.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they all seek after their own interests, not those of Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you know of his proven character, that he served with me in the furtherance of the gospel like a child serving his father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I hope to send him immediately, as soon as I see how things go with me;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I trust in the Lord that I myself will also be coming shortly.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I thought it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother and fellow worker and fellow soldier, who is also your messenger and minister to my need,
speaker: Narrator

text: because he was longing for you all and was distressed because you had heard that he was sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: For indeed he was sick to the point of death, but God had mercy on him, and not only on him but also on me, so that I would not have sorrow upon sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I have sent him all the more eagerly, so that when you see him again you may rejoice and I may be less concerned about you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Receive him then in the Lord with all joy, and hold people like him in high regard,
speaker: Narrator

text: because he came close to death for the work of Christ, risking his life to compensate for your absence in your service to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, my brothers and sisters, rejoice in the Lord. To write the same things again is no trouble for me, and it is a safeguard for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware of the dogs, beware of the evil workers, beware of the false circumcision;
speaker: Narrator

text: for we are the true circumcision, who worship in the Spirit of God and take pride in Christ Jesus, and put no confidence in the flesh,
speaker: Narrator

text: although I myself could boast as having confidence even in the flesh. If anyone else thinks he is confident in the flesh, I have more reason:
speaker: Narrator

text: circumcised the eighth day, of the nation of Israel, of the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew of Hebrews; as to the Law, a Pharisee;
speaker: Narrator

text: as to zeal, a persecutor of the church; as to the righteousness which is in the Law, found blameless.
speaker: Narrator

text: But whatever things were gain to me, these things I have counted as loss because of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: More than that, I count all things to be loss in view of the surpassing value of knowing Christ Jesus my Lord, for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and count them mere rubbish, so that I may gain Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: and may be found in Him, not having a righteousness of my own derived from the Law, but that which is through faith in Christ, the righteousness which comes from God on the basis of faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: that I may know Him and the power of His resurrection and the fellowship of His sufferings, being conformed to His death;
speaker: Narrator

text: if somehow I may attain to the resurrection from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that I have already grasped it all or have already become perfect, but I press on if I may also take hold of that for which I was even taken hold of by Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brothers and sisters, I do not regard myself as having taken hold of it yet; but one thing I do: forgetting what lies behind and reaching forward to what lies ahead,
speaker: Narrator

text: I press on toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, all who are mature, let’s have this attitude; and if in anything you have a different attitude, God will reveal that to you as well;
speaker: Narrator

text: however, let’s keep living by that same standard to which we have attained.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brothers and sisters, join in following my example, and observe those who walk according to the pattern you have in us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many walk, of whom I often told you, and now tell you even as I weep, that they are the enemies of the cross of Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: whose end is destruction, whose god is their appetite, and whose glory is in their shame, who have their minds on earthly things.
speaker: Narrator

text: For our citizenship is in heaven, from which we also eagerly wait for a Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ;
speaker: Narrator

text: who will transform the body of our lowly condition into conformity with His glorious body, by the exertion of the power that He has even to subject all things to Himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, my beloved brothers and sisters, whom I long to see, my joy and crown, stand firm in the Lord in this way, my beloved.
speaker: Narrator

text: I urge Euodia and I urge Syntyche to live in harmony in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, true companion, I ask you also, help these women who have shared my struggle in the cause of the gospel, together with Clement as well as the rest of my fellow workers, whose names are in the book of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice in the Lord always; again I will say, rejoice!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let your gentle spirit be known to all people. The Lord is near.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be anxious about anything, but in everything by prayer and pleading with thanksgiving let your requests be made known to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the peace of God, which surpasses all comprehension, will guard your hearts and minds in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, brothers and sisters, whatever is true, whatever is honorable, whatever is right, whatever is pure, whatever is lovely, whatever is commendable, if there is any excellence and if anything worthy of praise, think about these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the things you have learned and received and heard and seen in me, practice these things, and the God of peace will be with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I rejoiced in the Lord greatly, that now at last you have revived your concern for me; indeed, you were concerned before, but you lacked an opportunity to act.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that I speak from need, for I have learned to be content in whatever circumstances I am.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know how to get along with little, and I also know how to live in prosperity; in any and every circumstance I have learned the secret of being filled and going hungry, both of having abundance and suffering need.
speaker: Narrator

text: I can do all things through Him who strengthens me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, you have done well to share with me in my difficulty.
speaker: Narrator

text: You yourselves also know, Philippians, that at the first preaching of the gospel, after I left Macedonia, no church shared with me in the matter of giving and receiving except you alone;
speaker: Narrator

text: for even in Thessalonica you sent a gift more than once for my needs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that I seek the gift itself, but I seek the profit which increases to your account.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have received everything in full and have an abundance; I am amply supplied, having received from Epaphroditus what you have sent, a fragrant aroma, an acceptable sacrifice, pleasing to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And my God will supply all your needs according to His riches in glory in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now to our God and Father be the glory forever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet every saint in Christ Jesus. The brothers who are with me greet you.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the saints greet you, especially those of Caesar’s household.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
speaker: Narrator
